messages.original: Additional launches of Geran-2 drones have been recorded from:  Khalino Airbase, Kursk Oblast. Makiivka, Donetsk Oblast. Cape Chauda, Crimea Hvardiivske Airbase, Crimea Shatalovo Airbase, Smolensk Oblast Navlya Test Site, Bryansk Oblast  (not all of these‚Ä¶
Launches of Geran-2 drones have now been reported from 10 directions, each with one launch.
The airspace in the area of the Tu-95MS launch lines in Saratov Oblast has been closed for civilian aircraft.
There are currently at least 60 Geran-2/Gebera drones detected in Ukrainian airspace.

Launches of Geran-2/Gerbera drones have now taken place from all launch locations.
Repeated launches have been reported from four of these locations. 
~64 drones detected in Ukrainian airspace.

5 Tu-95MS and 1 Tu-160 carried out launch maneuvers. We will find out if these are real in the next 90 minutes. 
Additionally, Kalibrs missile launches were recorded from the Black Sea.
I won't be able to cover these missile strikes live, sorry. I will post about the consequences of the strikes afterwards, though. It looks like most/all missiles will fly to western Ukraine.
Over Rivne Oblast, flying towards Lviv City
Over Rivne Oblast, flying towards Lviv City
Explosions were heard in Lviv around 1 minute ago
The two explosions heard in Lviv
Kh-101 cruise missiles are now impacting Lviv. 5 more are flying in from the south.

Lviv is getting hit very hard. Several more impacts in the city.
Gerans have also been actively hitting targets.

There is a patriot battery operating in Lviv, but its not very effective as the missiles are actively using countermeasures. Additionally, the number of missiles detected on radars is smaller than reality as some are flying in tight groups, and are showing up as a single target. Approximately 16 Kh-101s have impacted in Lviv so far.

F-16s and Mirage-2000s seem to have done their job better than Patriots, though. A relatively significant portion (maybe around 25%) of missiles were intercepted over the western regions of Ukraine (Ternopil, Khmelnytskyi, Ivano-Frankivsk) before reaching cities.
A large fire is burning in Lviv. 8+ missiles impacted this target. I'm not quite sure what it is, but we should know soon.

Trump Targeting Generals, Courting Domestic Turmoil: ‚ÄúWar Against Enemies Within‚Äù
Quantico‚Äôs historic event revealed a US President confronting his generals, demanding loyalty, and escalating rhetoric against internal ‚Äúenemies,‚Äù fueling concern over domestic stability and US military cohesion.
On September 30, 2025, at Marine Corps Base Quantico in Virginia, an unusual scene unfolded ‚Äî one that may signal the start of a deep military crisis in the United States.¬†President Donald Trump, flanked by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth,¬†addressed¬†nearly 800 generals, admirals, and senior enlisted advisors ‚Äî summoned at short notice from global outposts, at considerable taxpayer expense, just as whispers of a government shutdown loomed.¬†What was billed as an unusual military gathering quickly turned into a clash.
Hegseth, in a 45-minute¬†tirade, lambasted ‚Äúfat generals‚Äù and decried the Pentagon‚Äôs ‚Äúdecades of decay‚Äù under diversity initiatives, vowing an end to ‚Äúdudes in dresses,‚Äù...

Israeli Army Halts Gaza City Offensive After Hamas Decision To Accept Trump‚Äôs Peace Plan 
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) was ordered to halt its offensive to capture Gaza City on October 4, after United States President Donald Trump announced that his peace plan for the Strip was accepted by Hamas.
Trump said late on October 3 that Hamas was ‚Äúready for a lasting PEACE‚Äù in the Strip after receiving the group‚Äôs positive response.
‚ÄúIsrael must immediately stop the bombing of Gaza, so that we can get the hostages out safely and quickly!‚Äù Trump wrote on Truth Social.
The peace plan, announced by Trump on September 29, demands an immediate ceasefire, hostage release within 72 hours, and Hamas‚Äôs disarmament, with Israel withdrawing on several stages and Palestinian technocrats taking over under international oversight for up to five years.

Russian Army Pushes Forward Between Seversk And Liman (Videos)
The Russian military continued to advance between Seversk and Liman in the Donetsk direction by October 4, despite facing resistance from Kiev forces.
Video footage confirmed that the Yug [South] Group of Forces has taken over Fedorivka, located to the south of Fedorivka, although the capture of the settlement is yet to be officially announced by the Russian Ministry of Defense. Russian troops are likely still working to fully secure their new positions there.

Disruption of Frontline Supplies: Russian Strikes on Ukraine's Key Infrastructure
On October 3‚Äì4, Russian forces struck energy facilities in Ukraine that support the operation of military-industrial complex enterprises and critical supply lines. Among the targets were energy facilities in the Sumy, Chernihiv, Kharkiv, and Dnipropetrovsk regions, as well as launch sites for long-range drones.
Former U.S. Air Force Vice Chief of Staff General Richard Newton announced an impending shift in Ukraine's approach to military operations ‚Äî from active defense to more decisive offensive actions. He emphasized that Ukraine should receive Tomahawk cruise missiles, which would enable it to strike Russian targets at distances of up to 800 miles. In his opinion, "This would allow the Ukrainian Armed Forces to strike Russian command posts, logistics centers, and oil infrastructure, which would change the nature of the war and give Kyiv a new strategic tool of influence."

Russian Troops Strangle Kiev Forces In Kupyansk (Videos)
The Russian military‚Äôs offensive in Kupyansk gained momentum on October 4, but Kiev is still attempting to hold onto the key city.
In a major push, the Zapad [West] Group of Forces broke through Ukrainian defenses between the eastern part of Kupyansk and its eastern outskirts. This successful push in addition to recent advances in the western part of the city left Kiev forces cornered in a narrow strip in the center, mainly along the Privokzalnaya street connected to the southern entrance of the city.
Intensive use of drones by Kiev forces has so far prevented the Russian military from completely besieging the remaining Ukrainian troops in Kupyansk. This will not go on for long, however.
üëâ
